text: But this is the frontier. The frontier is understanding how large scale collective decisions are being made that determine our anatomy and our, and our function. Now the bad news is that by themselves, these very important technologies such as genomic editing and molecular biology are not going to give us everything that we want. Because this process of going from a single cell egg to one of these complex bodies is this, this, this morphogenetic process is incredibly complex and recurrent. In other words, all of these cells are doing various things and together there's, they end up building something like this.
primary_topics: Large scale collective decisions in anatomy
content_summary: The speaker discusses the complexity of understanding how large scale collective decisions determine our anatomy and function. They note that while genomic editing and molecular biology are important technologies, they alone cannot fully explain the intricate process of morphogenesis, which transforms a single cell egg into a complex body.
